pr_title: Update log-destination to use the enumeration for LoggingDestination.

timeline.message:

Addresses #1641

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master' into 1641-log-destination

timeline.body:
Wouldn't it make more sense to just use:
```suggestion
  private LoggingDestination logDestination = LoggingDestination.DEFAULT_BOTH;
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Wouldn't it make more sense to just use:

Suggested change
private LoggingDestination logDestination = LoggingDestination.get(DEFAULT_LOG_DESTINATION);
private LoggingDestination logDestination = LoggingDestination.DEFAULT_BOTH;

replies.bodyText: just means its not set off the default - i can if you prefer...
replies.author: rolfyone

replies.bodyText: The DEFAULT_LOG_DESTINATION constant could also be of type LoggingDestination.  Although I really don't know why we've extracted all this stuff as constants and will likely do a pass through to inline them all when I get a chance.  It's so much easier to read in besu where the strings are used directly in the @Option annotations.
replies.author: ajsutton

timeline.body: The code that uses this value expects the `key` not the enum `name()`.  Currently key is internal only so a getter would be needed. I think it happens to work out at the moment but we should actually refer to the same value.  I suspect the `key` value is no longer relevant and we should just use `.valueOf` to look up the matching value.  Or just pass `LoggingDestination` enum through instead of going to `String` and back if the class path will let us do that.
